title: Chelsea's form improved after Frank Lampard 'laid into senior players' in team meeting

Frank Lampard reportedly laid into Chelsea's senior first-team players in order to reverse the club's form.

Chelsea had slumped to consecutive losses against Valencia, then Liverpool , when the Blues boss hauled his players into a showdown meeting.

Lampard, along with assistant Jody Morris, held the likes of Willian and Pedro to account and called on experienced members of the squad to take more responsibility.

Since the team meeting Chelsea have gone on a run of four wins on the bounce to thrust themselves level on points with 4th-placed Leicester in the Premier League.

Following Lampard's intervention, Chelsea have banged 15 goals and conceded just three, with Pedro, Willian, Jorginho, Michy Batshuayi and N'golo Kante all netting.

(Image: Chelsea FC via Getty Images)

The Mail report that Lampard did not want his younger stars like Tammy Abraham and Mason Mount picking up the slack for the club's poor form.

Abraham has been in red-hot form, leading the divisions scoring charts with eight goals in as many games.

Teammate Mount has also contributed his fair share from midfield, with four goals, leading to both players earning international call-ups with England.

Defender Fikayo Tomori has also been drafted into the national squad after his impressive displays caught the eye of Three Lions boss Gareth Southgate.

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

Chelsea continue to wait on the services of Ruben Loftus-Cheek though, who is still some way from a return to action.

The 23-year-old continues to recover from a nasty achilles injury sustained at the end of last season, but has hit a few obstacles.

“I’ve actually had a few setbacks that have put me behind which has been quite frustrating to be honest," Loftus-Cheek told WOWHYDRATE.

(Image: Chelsea FC via Getty Images)

"I’ve had to learn to walk again and I’ve only just got pain free but for sure I’m going to come back stronger, sharper and do whatever I can to be in better shape.

“Before I got injured I was playing my best football. I’ve missed feeling tired from running, from hard work, that feeling of being in a game again.

“Everything I’ve been working towards is for the feeling of stepping back onto that pitch again and I’m ready to go.”
description: The Blues responded to two consecutive defeats with a run of four wins on the bounce after showdown talks
